info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 19 at 3:26PM EDT until June 20 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Cleveland OH has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio...
Cuyahoga River At Independence affecting Cuyahoga County.
For the Cuyahoga River...including Hiram Rapids, Jaite, Old Portage, Independence...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Cuyahoga River at Independence.
* WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Tinkers Creek and Mill Creek backup due to high flows on the Cuyahoga River. Canal Road inundated. At 18.5 feet, Water backs up on Murray and Fosdick Roads in Valley View. Portions of Exchange Road, Wall Street, and Cloverleaf Road inundated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.0 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/cle.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 130 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT
